text: Rooster Teeth Productions, LLC. or Rooster Teeth is a movie making company in Austin, Texas, United States. It makes live action short videos, animated videos, video game animations, and voiced video game playing called Let's Play. The creator, Burnie Burns, made voice-over videos of Bungie Studios' big first-person shooter video game Halo: Combat Evolved. These videos led to the making of Red vs. Blue, an awarded funny science-fiction set of videos released on April 1, 2003. These are still being made, and its 12th season came out on April 28, 2014. Rooster Teeth also makes live-action short videos, funny game play under the name Achievement Hunter, making video games, and full animated videos such as RWBY. Rooster Teeth hosts its community meeting, RTX, yearly in Austin, Texas. In 2015, Rooster Teeth released its large movie debut, Lazer Team, a science-fiction funny movie. On March 6, 2024, it was announced that Rooster Teeth would shut down. ==References== Category:Companies based in Texas Category:2003 establishments in the United States Category:2000s establishments in Texas Category:American movie studios
title: Rooster Teeth
